intro: Hieracium oxyodon subsp. amauradenium, commonly known as the golden hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Native to southern Europe, it thrives in dry, sunny environments such as grasslands and rocky soils. The plant produces small, elongated seeds that are dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Hieracium genus, known for its variability and adaptability.
